thread.title: Norwich City pay tribute to John Hurt with match day applause on 77th minute to remember Canaries fan

author: Alistair McGeorge
title: Norwich City pay tribute to John Hurt with match day applause on 77th minute to remember Canaries fan

organizations.name: invalid email  norwich city football club

text:
Norwich City plan John Hurt tribute with match day applause on 77th minute to remember Canaries fan The legendary actor passed away aged 77 Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Norwich City Football Club will remember one of its most famous fans as they pay tribute to Sir John Hurt following his sad death this week . 
The iconic actor - who had an illustrious career with roles in the like of The Elephant Man, Alien and Doctor Who - lived in north Norfolk and was a big fan of the Canaries. 
He frequently supported them at their Carrow Road stadium both as a fan and guest of the Directors - and fans at the ground will recognise him during Saturday's match with Birmingham City. (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
At the 77th minute - to mark the age Sir John passed away - supporters will lead a moment's applause in his honour as a mark of respect. Read More 
He also had strong links in the local community, included his role as chancellor of Norwich University of the Arts, and a patron of Cinema City. Carrow Road (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Carrow Road (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
After rising to fame in A Man For All Seasons (1966), some of his most famous roles include the TV series I, Claudius in 1976 as well as starring as Winston Smith in the adaptation of George Orwellâ€™s 1984. 
More recently, he starred as wandmaker Mr Ollivander in the Harry Potter series and an incarnation of Doctor Who in a 50th anniversary special of the series in 2013. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
